item.title: Report E-2024100302
item.description:
Report E-2024100302

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-12T21:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-08
  • City: PRINCETON
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 8, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2924 was punctured and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental and Emergency (E3) to remediate the impacted site. E3 personnel placed the damaged 55-gallon drum into one (1) 85-gallon salvage drum that was labeled as salvaged material for return to the terminal. The released material had dried by the time crews arrived, so crews inspected the trailer to ensure no further remediation was needed.

item.title: Report E-2024100313
item.description:
Report E-2024100313

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-12T21:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-18
  • City: EDINBURGH
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1240 ET, Rachel with XPO-XCM notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 2 quarts of weld on duit 411 gray released from a metal pail due to improper loading, box fell crushing some of the pails inside the cardboard box The release impacted just inside the cardboard box. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site.

item.title: Report X-2024100527
item.description:
Report X-2024100527

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-10T09:22:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-07
  • City: SOUTH BEND
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Alan Fozo Service Center Manager called safety to report report evidence of a spill in trailer 84740, UN1648, ACETONITRILE 3 PG II. 1 Gallon pail. Alan stated when the crew opened the trailer door on the trailer and started to unload, they found a box that looked to have been forked by a forklift. A lan stated the only evidence of the spill was the hole in the box and a damaged 1 gallon pail in the box that was dry. Alan stated it looks like the ACETONITRILE had evaporated and left no trace of the spill. Alan stated he was going to take the damaged pail and place it in a recovery pail with Pro Number in OSD. Alan stated after removing the pallet and the box from the skid, there was no spill to be cleaned other than a damaged glass pail in the box. Alan stated the box that was damaged by the forklift blade was done at the loading facility and found the damaged box at SC 106 in trailer 847 40 while unloading.

item.description:
Report I-2024080137

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When the vac box was dropped in the yard, the bottom scrapped along the asphalt, which resulted in the chains on the door being loosened up. With chains loose, the seal on the door was not effective causing the spill to come out the top of the box.

item.title: Report E-2024100193
item.description:
Report E-2024100193

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-09T09:22:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-10
  • City: SOUTH BEND
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 9:16 AM ET, XSB contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in South Bend, IN. The spill consists of approximately 20 gallons of 991WP609-DO Armor HP Global, which released from 1â€“55-gallon metal drum, due to be improper packaging by the shipper. The terminal discovered the spill from inside the shrink wrap leaking out onto the trailer floor, there were no punctures visible. The terminal has already overpacked the container into a 95-gallon metal overpack.
